SENT.plain: A 27-year-old man with aplastic anemia and renal insufficiency requiring dialysis underwent allogeneic PBSCT
The preparative regimen consisted of melphalan, ATG and TLI
GVHD prophylaxis consisted of cyclosporine and prednisolone
He was dialyzed prior to administration of melphalan and at 24 and 72 h after it
Otherwise, the dialysis schedule was unchanged, at three times a week
Pharmacokinetic parameters of melphalan were not significantly altered with its plasma half-life 1.5 h
Patients with renal failure can receive allogeneic HSCT, and a combination of melphalan, ATG and TLI may serve as an alternative to CY and ATG
